definition[0]: a tax on goods coming into a country or going out of a country
example[0]: The government may impose tariffs on imports.
definition[1]: a list of fixed prices charged by a hotel or restaurant, for example for the cost of meals or rooms
definition[2]: a list or system of prices which mobile phone companies charge for the services they provide
definition[3]: a tax on goods coming into a country or going out of it
example[1]: France and Germany imposed import tariffs on grain.
example[2]: Canadian retailers said that higher tariffs in Canada compared with the U.S. were contributing to higher prices on some goods sold in Canada.
definition[4]: a list of fixed prices, especially ones that change, depending on the time, day etc
example[3]: Telephone tariffs are set by a government model to provide a 12% real rate of return.
